poem:
Title: Wrestling With the Morning News 

In the quiet echo of political banter,
Scribbled figures, subterfuge and the Lib Dem's canter,
Lost in the papery maze of politics and bets,
A £2,000 question answers yet begets.

A sudden tryst with Rishi, a voter's pale surprise,
Haunted by Labour's phantom, in headlines it lies.
Beneath the day's retelling, in the unassuming mist,
Democracy dances clumsily, persisting in her tryst.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Campaign catchup: Fake figures, stealth taxes and a speeding Lib Dem Good afternoon. Who won the debate, then? Who won it? Stop stalling and speak up! Who won it! Somebody must have won it, who was it! I have £2,000 riding on this! More on this, local housing allowance and a voter who surely didn’t expect to be cornered by Rishi Sunak after the headlines. What happened today Labour | After being barred as the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
